intro: Sacciolepis geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a striking flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted stems and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and is known for its ornamental value. Its foliage consists of long, narrow leaves that are often variegated with yellow or white markings. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
